result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kevin Maurice Carter in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for return on doctor's report.  Court reviewed report with parties.  There are no challenges to the report.  Court held colloquy with defendant who informed the court he does not challenge the report by Dr. Collins dated May 17, 2022 finding that the defendant is not competent to proceed.   Attorney Obscherning informs the court that defendant is now under the care of his family. Court ordered defendant released from commitment under Wisconsin Statute 971.14(6).  Court suspended the proceedings and scheduled a review hearing date in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Branch 13, RESERVE JUDGES, in Room 508 of the Courthouse.  Review hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
from Dr. Collins submitted 5/17/22, received and filed.

22RM023805  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/29/2022 sa
for Competency Examination, signed and filed

Attorney Sam Obscherning in court, defendant Kevin Maurice Carter not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

As newly appointed counsel, SPD Sam Obscherning emailed the court regarding a conflict with the 5/11/2022 pretrial conference date.  Court amended the date to 4/11/2022 at 9:00 am.  Attorney Obscherning to notify the defendant of the amended court date.    vk

Court ordered no contact with all Social Security Offices in Milwaukee County WI and their employees.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No possession of any explosive materials.

Defendant Kevin Maurice Carter in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Kevin Maurice Carter in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
